reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed here for a few nights one weekend in October. While the innkeeper is friendly and the rooms are basically ok, we were disappointed with the cleanliness (dead fly in a corner, dust on the floor) and the breakfast ("the worst eggs I've ever eaten" - quote from my fiance). While it is conveniently located, there are many inns in this price range that offer similar rooms and a better breakfast. I suggest looking around - check the Inn at Thorn Hill or the Eastmann Inn in North Conway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only unfortunate thing about the hotel was the fact that we'd only booked to stay there one night!
reviews.title: Lovely Inn

likes.liked: — Very comfortable room and excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the Honeymoon Suite (and us married almost 34 years!) which was lovely. A big king size bed and a lovely room. Breakfast was excellent and the host couldn't have been more helpful with advice on where to eat.
reviews.title: We loved the Inn at Jackson

reviews.text: Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the extra touches in all the rooms,

likes.liked: — Everything was available for our use.
likes.disliked: — Needed a reading lamp by the bed.

reviews.title: Unsurpassed
reviews.text: Stayed at the Inn at Jackson for 2 nights w/ my husband. It was wonderful. Very pretty common rooms and our bedroom was lovely. Don the Innkeeper is terrific. Very informative and friendly. Great breakfasts and snacks in the afternoon. I would hightly recommend this Inn. We cannot wait to return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After eloping in New Hampshire, my wife and I went to stay at the Inn at Jackson for four days. We have stayed at many Bed and Breakfasts (as well as nicer hotels), as we do a lot of traveling. We can say - unequivocally - that the Inn at Jackson is PERFECT! First, it's very clean (that's always our major concern). The location is great; not right in the hustle and bustle of North Conway, but just a few minutes outside the tourist spots. We love mountain hiking, and the Inn is close to Mount Washington and other natural attractions in the White Mountains. The Breakfasts were wonderful - considering both quality and quantity. We had ours served up at our room for a few mornings, which was a nice touch. However, the downstairs 'communal' breakfast was great, too, as there are separate small tables for each guest party if you don't like being forced eating with everyone at the B&B. Don, the Innkeeper, was friendly and knowledgeable about the area, as you'd expect. But he made the extra effort to try and think of ways to customize our visit based on our unique set of circumstances, which we greatly appreciated. Good restaurants nearby, incredible views, and a great massage at Moondance. The Inn at Jackson deserves its reputation - it's absolutely perfect. We will be back next year!
reviews.title: Perfect!

likes.liked: — Our beautiful, spacious, spotless room with a comfortable, king-sized bed.
likes.disliked: — That we had to leave at the end.

reviews.text: If you're looking for a wonderful Inn with friendly knowledgible hosts and staff, lovely rooms with just a little extra, a phenomenal breakfast, beautiful scenery, both shopping and outdoor activities, you need to reserve a room at the Inn at Jackson. Having visited the area a couple of times several years ago and stayed somewhere else, I returned with my daughter and decided to book our mother/daughter getaway at the Inn after visiting their excellent website and reading all the glowing reviews online. It was an excellent decision. The Innkeepers clearly care about your experience and go out of their way to make it what you want, whether it's suggesting restaurants in the area or places of interest to visit. I can't say enough good things about our stay and sincerely hope to return.
reviews.title: Relaxing Retreat
A relaxing stay
reviews.text: The Inn at Jackson is a beautifully appointed bed and breakfast. The new owners have worked with their designer to create a warm and welcoming atmosphere. There is an attention to detail at the Inn that is pleasing to all of the senses, the music playing, the furnishings (including the most comfortable king size bed I've ever had the pleasure to sleep in), the yummy breakfasts prepared by Don, the hot tub with the complimentry turkish bathrobes...All of the details add up to a relaxing stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don and Joyce were very helpful with suggestions for dining and for working off the breakfasts and gourmet dinners in the beautiful White Mountains. Whether you are interested in hiking, skiing, kayaking, of just relaxing by a roaring fire after a day of outdoor activities, the Inn at Jackson is the perfect home base. New England at it's best. We look forward to returning to the White Mountains and the Inn at Jackson.
reviews.title: Will Return As Soon as Possible
a wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: Indeed the Inn's slogan rings true:

reviews.title: Jackson's real Jewel is the Inn
reviews.text: After my long weekend at the Inn in Jackson, I am totally in love with the Inn. I am not a cold weather fan, so having a room with a fireplace was so warm and relaxing. I found myself just wanting to go to my room or spend time in the living room area. The atmosphere in the Inn is so welcoming that you really feel at home. The food is excellent, and the Innkeepers are all so wonderful and accomodating.

reviews.title: Home away from home!
reviews.text: If you can tear yourself away from the Inn, the White Mountains provide plenty to see and do and Jackson is a quaint town with shops, restaurants and great scenery. If you want to spend time in New Hampshire, you need to make this a "must do" on your list. You will not be sorry. There were 8 in our group, and we can't wait to go back again.

reviews.title: Location, Location
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a relaxing and fun weekend.

reviews.title: blissfully thawing experience!!
reviews.text: The new owner made us feel very welcome and was most accommodating. Our package included a voucher at Thompson's restaurant where we were treated with great service and a superior meal despite it being a Sunday evening. At the Inn we were able to receive a complimentary cross-country ski

ticket and begin our morning ski trip literally out the backdoor. Our room was very comfortable, tastefully decorated, pleasantly quiet and offered a lovely view to the west. The hot tub was an added bonus. And for those like my wife who enjoy poking around there is delightful gift shop at the foot of the hill filled to the ceiling with whimsical treats. We hope to return during the summer.
reviews.title: Harry Potter's cupboard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in March 07, snow on the ground and temperatures lowest since 1943! What a wonderful inn, cosy, immaculately clean, well appointed rooms (ours had a fire place) very romantic, and an outdoor hot tub which was fabulous when temperatures were soooooo cold outside! Don the innkeeper was very accommodating and made wonderful breakfasts. We would have no hesitation in recommending the inn to anyone, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Cozy Mountain Retreat
I fell in love!
reviews.text: We stayed 3 days at this Inn on our tour of New England in September 2006. This was the most superior of all the accommodations we booked and we will definitely be returning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in October - it was initially supposed to be one but the debacle that pretends to be an airline that is called FlyGlobeSpan enabled/enforced us to revise our itenerary. We had to change rooms, but all our luggage etc. was moved for us with the minimum of fuss. The Inn is spotless, very reasonably priced and very welcoming. Don is a great host, a real 'people' person who had a very welcoming and accomodating manner. We stayed in a variety of top hotels as well on a touring trip, but I think The Inn at Jackson trumped the lot of them. Breakfast was especially nice! The only downside was the weather didn't allow us to see the area in it's full glory, but at least that gives us an excuse to return!
reviews.title: Great little place with character

reviews.text: Stop reading now and book this place! That is all you need to know. From the moment we walked in, we knew it was special. From the enclosed porch with the pretty wicker furniture to the cozy living room with fireplace and soft music, the public areas were so warm and inviting. Don greeted us and gave us a tour and then showed us our room, #3, which was out of a story book. We had a fireplace, a window seat, and a king sized bed that was so comfortable that the only thing that could entice us to get out of it was the incredible breakfasts! Breakfast was fantastic with four choices of entrees each morning, along w/ fruit, pastries, cereal, coffee, tea and juice. There were yummy afternoon snacks in the small, quaint bar area where you can get to know your fellow guests, if you choose. The Inn doesn't serve alcohol but will provide you with glasses, corkscrew, and a communal fridge where you can store your own. It was so nice to curl up on a porch sofa and enjoy a glass of wine in the evening. The hot tub during the rain was also a highlight. The Inn is so conveniently located. You can walk to anywhere in the town from here. Don is helpful with dinner suggestions and reservations and shares his knowledge of the area. He made us feel so welcome. We LOVED this place and cannot wait to return!
reviews.title: Loved this place!

likes.liked: — the tranquility, the attention to detail, the breakfasts

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: The Inn at Jackson is a very comfortable and cozy inn. This was our first stay at an Inn and we enjoyed it so very much. Great inn keeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: & comfortable atmosphere will be bringing us back again again. The 6 from Needham/Medfield MA
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: My Wife and i stayed at the Inn at Jackson for 3 nights (Columbus weekend), it was lovely.
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a beautiful place - you are made to feel at home as soon as you walk through the door. Don is the perfect host - instantly there if you need him but not so over-attentive that you are made to feel uncomfortable. The inn is beautifully decorated with great taste and there are many extra touches (like the help-yourself DVD library) to make you feel at home. And then of course, there's the breakfast!!
reviews.title: Just perfect
Great experience
reviews.text: A lovely place in a beautiful village.

We've been to many Bed and Breakfasts through out New England. This was nicest one we've been to. The Inn itself was newly remodeled and in beatiful condition. The innkeepers Don and Joyce have provided all the right touches and are outstanding hosts. Chef Sue does incredilble things with breakfast.
reviews.title: Hospitality at its best...only place I'll stay when I visit the area!

reviews.text: This B&B is located in the White Mountains and they provide beautiful scenery. Along with sight seeing there are many other activities to do here.
reviews.title: Really Does Not Get Better Than This For A Weekend Getaway...
Perfect Place, Perfect Stay
reviews.text: We would highly recomend a visit.
